column1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease 13 x 9-inch baking pan. In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar and buttermix well. Press half of the mixture evenly into the bottom of the pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Combine egg, coffee granules, almond extract and milk in a small bowl. Brush this mixture over the baked crust. Sprinkle sliced almonds evenly over the mocha layer. Press remaining crust mixture over the almond layergently press into place. Bake for 20 minutes or until the top is lightly browned. Cool completely on a wire rack. In a small bowl, combine the powdered sugar and almond extractdrizzle evenly over the bars. Cut into bars with a sharp knife. Makes 12 bars.

Heat oven to 350f. In large skillet, saute sausage until no longer pinkdrain well. Add onion and celery. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until onion is tender. In large bowl, combine sausage mixture, stuffing mix, mushrooms, chicken broth, and seasoningstoss well. Spread mixture in 13x9x2 baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes or until lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Line 13 x 9 inch baking pan with foil, with ends of foil extending over sides of pan. Spray foil with cooking spray. To prepare stuffing, combine cubed dry bread with cooked turkey. Add onion, eggs, salt, pepper, and poultry seasoning. Stir well. Add milk if desired. Spoon mixture into pan. Place in oven and bake 25 minutes. Remove from oven. Remove foil from baking pan. Turn stuffing over onto cutting board. Spray baking pan with cooking spray. Sprinkle surface of stuffing with swiss cheese. Roll stuffing up in baking pan. Bake 5 minutes. Cut into 6 slices.

Cook pasta according to package directions. In a skillet or wok over medium heat, combine broccoli florets and stock. Cook until florets are just tender-crunchy. Transfer to a large mixing bowl. In the same skillet or wok, combine the soy sauce, vinegar, and crushed red pepper. Stir in the pasta and mix well. Add the peanut butter and mix well. Add the broccoli mixture and toss together. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings.

Cook macaroni al dente. Drain. In a large bowl, combine macaroni, mayonnaise, nutritional yeast, milk substitute, salt and pepper. Mix well. Shape mixture into a loaf. Roll loaf in breadcrumbs. Bake at 350 degrees f. for 30 minutes. Let cool 5 minutes before serving.

Brown sausages. Drain fat. Add onion and saute until tender. Add bacon and continue cooking. Add soup mix and mix well. Add vegetables and mix well. Place in 1-1/2 quart casserole sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for about 30 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley just before serving.

Spread white bread with peanut butter. Spread whole wheat bread with jelly. Put peanut butter side of the white bread together with jelly side of the wheat bread. Press goldfish crackers into the sandwich. Cut each sandwich into four pieces.
1. In a medium bowl combine spinach, cheese, butter, green onions, eggs, salt and pepper and just enough bread crumbs to make the mixture hold together. Shape into 1-inch balls. Arrange in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Bake 10 to 15 minutes until lightly browned.
2. In a large bowl combine the milk and Bisquick. Mix well. Add in the margarine or butter, then the eggs. Stir together well.
3. Add in the bacon pieces, green onion and mushrooms. Stir well.
4. Pour into a pie plate. Sprinkle with the cheese.
5. Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees.
2. Drain broccoli well. Add soup, eggs, cheese, mayonnaise

Dredge the chicken breast halves with the flour. Heat the oil in a large skillet. Brown the chicken breasts on each side. Remove the breasts and set aside. Add the soy sauce and the brown sugar to the skillet. Bring to a boil and boil for 2 minutes. Add the chicken breasts and the juice from the can of crushed pineapple. Add the pineapple chunks. Cover and simmer for 2 minutes. Remove the chicken breasts and place them on a serving platter. Pour the sauce over the chicken. Garnish with parsley. Serve with white rice. Serves 4.

In a mixing bowl beat together the butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs and vanilla. Stir together the dry ingredients and add to the creamed mixture. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto greased baking sheets. Bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for 10 minutes. Let cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes. Move to a wire rack and cool completely.

Pour grapefruit juice into a shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass. Squeeze a wedge of lime into the drink. Drop a maraschino cherry into the glass. Top off with vodka. Serve immediately.

Combine sugar and water in a medium saucepan. Cook and stir over medium heat until the sugar is dissolved. Stir in orange juice, lemon juice, almond flavoring and vanilla. Bring to a boil. Simmer until reduced by half. Stir in spices and remove from heat. Stir in almond extract and set aside. Serve hot or cold.

Beat eggs, milk and cheddar cheese in a bowl. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Pour egg mixture into the pan and cook for 30 seconds or until eggs are set. Add green onions and jalapeno pepper. Cook for 30 seconds or until eggs are set. Remove from the heat and sprinkle with pepper and salt.

Place the strawberries into the blender. Add 1 1/2 cups of ginger ale. Blend on low until strawberries are chopped. Add milk and sugar to blender. Blend on low until the sugar is dissolved. Add the lemon juice and vanilla. Blend on low until the soup is smooth. Pour into 4 serving bowls and top with the sour cream. This recipe is really good over vanilla ice cream too.

Mix together the juice, hoisin sauce, honey and ginger. Place salmon fillets in a dish. Pour the sauce over the fillets. Bake at 375 degrees until fish flakes easily with a fork. Garnish with green onions. Serves 6.

Dice the roasted red peppers and blend with the remaining pesto ingredients until smooth. Thread chicken onto the skewers. Heat a grill to medium high heat. Grill the skewers for 3 minutes per side. Drizzle with the pesto and serve. Serves 4.

Process blue cheese in a food processor until creamy. Add butter and process until blended. Add lemon juice and process until combined. Stir in salt and pepper. Set aside. Cut the vegetables into large pieces. Brush with the lemon juice mixture. Grill vegetables until tender and lightly charred. Serve with blue cheese butter.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Trim off excess fat from the pork loin. Pat the roast dry with paper towels. In a small bowl, combine the garlic with the salt and pepper. Rub the spice mixture over the pork. In a small saucepan over low heat, warm the butter with the onions until the onions are translucent. Place the pork roast in a shallow baking dish and pour the warm onions over the top. Bake for 45-50 minutes. Remove from the oven and let rest for 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Mix together pears, pumpkin, sugar, flour, baking soda and spice. Stir in figs. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake for 1 1/2 hours in the preheated oven, until a knife inserted near center comes out clean. Cool before serving.

In large bowl, cream together butter and brown sugar until smooth. Blend in vanilla and flour until dough is easy to handle. Press dough into an ungreased 9x13 inch baking dish and bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes. Combine graham cracker crumbs and melted semi-sweet chocolate. Spread over baked crust. Sprinkle with mini marshmallows and chopped nuts. Bake at 350 degrees F for 2 to 3 minutes or until marshmallows are slightly browned. Cool completely in dish before cutting into bars. Makes 18 bars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Coat a large baking sheet with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine oats, almonds, wheat germ, honey, cinnamon and nutmeg. Stir until well mixed. Spread oat mixture evenly onto baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes. Remove from oven and stir in dried fruit. Bake 10 more minutes. Remove from oven. Let cool. Break into clusters and store in an airtight container.

Place oranges in a pan with the sugar and vanilla bean. Pour the liqueur over the oranges. Pour the brandy over the top. Heat the liquid over medium heat until boiling. Turn off the heat and allow the oranges to soak in the liquid overnight. Serve on their own, or with ice cream.

Combine margarine and sugar, beat until creamy. Add eggs and vanilla, beat until creamy. Add cocoa and flour and mix well. Spread into a greased and floured 10x15 pan. Bake for 25 minutes in a preheated oven of 350 degrees. Remove and sprinkle with nuts and chips. Bake for another 5 minutes. Remove and let cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a loaf pan. In a large bowl, combine sugar substitute and butter. Beat well. Add egg substitute and vanilla. Blend. Sift together flour and baking soda. Add to mixture and blend well. Spread batter in loaf pan. Bake 40 to 45 minutes. Cool 5 minutes. Mash pineapple with sugar substitute and cinnamon. Spread over top of cooled bread. Bake 5 minutes more. Cool completely. Drizzle with caramel sauce. Makes 1 loaf.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a 9x13-inch pan with aluminum foil, with ends of foil extending over sides of pan. Grease foil with shorteningset aside. In a large saucepan, combine the sugar, cocoa powder, salt and vanilla. Stir to blend well, then add the water. Heat to boiling over medium-high heat, stirring constantly until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heatadd the eggs, one at a time, stirring until smooth after each addition. Stir in the flour. Spread the batter into the prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until the center is set and toothpick inserted in the middle of the pan comes out clean. Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack. Once cool, lift brownies from pan with foil using the edges of the foil. Cut into squares. Makes approximately 24 brownies.

Cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Cool and crumble. Combine broccoli and onion. In small bowl combine sugar and vinegar. Combine with broccoli mixture and bacon. Mix well and refrigerate several hours. Just before serving add Miracle Whip and cheese. Mix well and serve immediately.

Pour Bacardi Limon, lemonade concentrate, lemon concentrate, lime juice into a shaker. Add ice cubes. Shake well. Pour into a collins glass or cocktail glass. Serve.

In saucepan over medium-low heat, combine jelly and port. Stir until jelly dissolves. Remove from heat. Stir in orange rind and let cool. Place cherries, red currants, and blueberries in bottom of trifle dish or bowl. Pour jelly and port mixture over berries. Refrigerate until cold. Arrange strawberries and raspberries over berries, then arrange blackberries on top. Add mint and chill for at least one hour before serving.
Puree mangoes in a blender. Add the juices and blend until smooth. Add club soda and blend to combine. Pour into glasses filled with ice cubes and garnish with a sprig of mint.
Combine all in a large mixing bowl. Stir thoroughly. Spread out onto wax paper, separating mixture into approximately 25 equal portions. Allow to dry for 2-3 hours. Store in airtight container.

Sift cornmeal, flour, baking powder and sugar together into a large mixing bowl. Add beaten egg, beer and mix well. Add onion and jalapeno and stir to mix. Heat 3 inches of oil in a deep fryer or heavy deep skillet to 375 degrees. Using an ice cream scoop or small spoon drop batter by the heaping teaspoon into hot oil. Fry 3 to 4 minutes or until golden brown and remove to paper towel to drain.

Cut a 2 inch piece from the middle of the challah loaf. Spread 1 tbsp butter on each side of the cut section of the loaf. Sprinkle the basil evenly over the butter. Top with tomatoes. Slice the brie cheese into 6 slices. Place a cheese slice over the tomatoes. Top with another slice of bread. Slice into 3 inch pieces.

Place the lamb chops between two sheets of plastic wrap and pound out to 1/4 inch thickness. Place in a shallow dish and add vinegar, olive oil and lemon juiceseason with salt and pepper. Marinate for at least 1 hour or overnight. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add chops and cook to desired doneness (about 3-4 minutes on each side for medium rare.) Remove from pan and keep warm. Add garlic to the pan and saute for 1 minute. Add the rosemary and cook for 30 seconds more. Pour over the chops and serve immediately.

Chop zucchini into 1/2 inch pieces. In a large pot of boiling water, cook the zucchini until just tender but not mushy- about 4 minutes. Drain and run under cold water. Pat zucchini dry. Toss with oil. Sprinkle with salt. Roast at 375 for 45 minutes. Combine garlic, lime juice, pepper and oregano. Toss with squash. Garnish with parsley.
Blend sugar with olive oil and mayo. Add mustards and blend. Add garlic powder and dill weed. Blend and add more seasonings to taste. Serve with pretzels.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Wrap pears with bacon and place in a baking dish or pan, pour the apple cider over the top of the pears and cook for 30 minutes or until the pears are soft when pierced with a fork. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 5 minutes. In a small bowl whisk together the vinaigrette and pour over the salad greens. Place the salad greens on a platter and top with the pears and pecans. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese and serve.

Grease a 9 x 13 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Cut the bread into 1 inch cubes. In a large bowl, combine bread cubes with cheese, bacon, eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Spread in the prepared pan. Bake for 20-30 minutes or until golden. Let cool. Cut into squares to serve.

Put a large skillet over medium heat. Add the fish and cook for 2 minutes on each side until done. Set aside to rest. In the same skillet cook the scallops for 2 minutes on each side until done. Remove to a warmed serving platter. In a small bowl, combine the lemon rind with the green peppercorns and juice. Add the butter and heat until melted. Add the lemon-peppercorn mixture to the skillet and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat, pour over the fish and scallops and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine first 3 ingredients in a bowlstir with a whisk. Combine sugar, butter, and egg yolks in a large bowlbeat with an electric mixer until well blended. Add flour mixture and vanilla extractmix until blended. Fold in chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded tablespoons onto lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks. Makes 10 dozen.

Combine crust ingredients. Press into a pie pan. Refrigerate. Combine filling ingredients. Spread over crust. Refrigerate until set. Top with whipped topping. Refrigerate. Cut into wedges and serve.

Cook pasta in boiling water according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Melt butter in a large skillet. Add rice and bouillon to butter. Stir and cook for 5 minutes. Add onion and garlic powder. Stir until well combined. Add water and lemon juice. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes over low heat until liquid is absorbed. Stir in cooked pasta. Top with parsley and serve.

Place the cabbage in a large bowl. Add the carrots, onion and mayonnaise. Whisk together the vinegar, sugar, mustard, black pepper and cayenne in a small bowl. Add to the cabbage mixturetoss well to combine.

Preheat oven to 350. Peel sweet potatoes. Cut lengthwise into quarters. Brush with dark sesame oil. Place in 9" x 13" glass baking dish. Roast for 40 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Bake 5 minutes more or until browned. Meanwhile, in small saucepan, combine low sodium soy sauce, mirin and garlic. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer 3 minutes. Stir in brown sugar. Remove from heat. Pour over sweet potatoes. Sprinkle with nori. Bake 5 minutes longer. Garnish with toasted sesame seeds. Serve hot.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the garlic and cook until it starts to turn golden and fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the cherry tomatoes and cook until the tomatoes start to break down and the pan is filled with a thick sauce, about 10 minutes. Add the white wine and cook until the sauce thickens and clams open up, about 5 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper. Add the clams and cook until they are heated through, about 1 minute more. Taste and add more salt and pepper if needed. Garnish the top of the clams with parsley and serve with the bread.

In a shallow bowl, combine the flour, garlic salt, salt, celery salt and pepper. Dip chicken in mixture. Place chicken in a lightly oiled skillet and brown chicken on both sides. Place chicken in a shallow dish and sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350f for 30-40 minutes or until the juices run clear when the chicken is pierced with a sharp knife.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut pears in half and core. Place in baking dish. Combine raisins, maple syrup, vanilla extract and 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon in small bowl. Spoon over pears. Sprinkle remaining 1/4 teaspoon of cinnamon over pears. Bake 30 minutes or until pears are tender. Serve immediately.

Boil carrots until tender crisp. Drain well. In a food processor or blender, combine the cooked carrots with the garlic and blend until smooth. Add vegetable stock and thyme and blend until smooth. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Separate the biscuits. Roll each out into a circle. Place on baking sheet and bake 5 minutes. Cool. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine cream cheese and sugar. Beat in egg and vanilla. Stir in cinnamon. Spread 1 tablespoon filling on each biscuit. Roll up jelly roll style and place seam side down on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake 15 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Drizzle with syrup. Sprinkle with nuts.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large bowl, mix the taco seasoning and oil. In a separate bowl, mix the cheese and egg. Peel the potatoes and cut them into 1/4-inch thick rounds. Place each round in a single layer on a piece of aluminum foil. Divide the taco mixture between the potatoes and cover the potatoes with the seasoning. Sprinkle each potato with cheese-egg mixture. Bake the potatoes for 30 to 35 minutes or until the potatoes are tender and the cheese is melted.
Cook oatmeal with milk and cinnamon to taste. Add banana pieces. Top with cereal.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onioncook and stir until onion is tender. Add turkeycook 10 minutes or until turkey is cooked through and no longer pink, stirring often. Stir in tomatoesbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in beansheat through. Sprinkle with chili powdertop with pepper and Sazon Goya.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and mash with sour cream and milk. Add the chives and season with salt and pepper. Pour into a baking dish and top with the cheese. Mix the corn flakes and melted butter and sprinkle over the top. Bake for 30 minutes or until brown.

Place lentils and bay leaves in a medium saucepan. Add 4 cups of water. Bring to a simmer and skim off any foam. Cover and cook until the lentils are tender, about 30 minutes. Drain. Add the remaining 1 cup of water. Cook until the lentils are tender. Drain the lentils in a colander and rinse under cold running water. Return to the pan. Add the olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Toss with the orange segments. Let the mixture stand 10 minutes. Add the onion. Toss well. Divide the salad among four plates. Garnish with the orange slices.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease 9x13 baking pan. Mix flour, baking powder & salt, set aside. Cream butter, sugar & eggs for 2 minutes. Add vanilla & peanut butter, mix well. Add flour mixture & mix well. Pour into greased pan. Sprinkle with nuts & chocolate chips. Bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown & center is set. Cool on wire rack. Cut into bars. Makes about 18 bars.

Spray 13x9x2-inch glass baking dish with vegetable oil cooking spray. Layer 6 tortillas evenly into baking dish, overlapping slightly. Sprinkle with 2 cups cheddar cheese. Spread with 1 can enchilada sauce, then sprinkle with 1 can chili without beans, 1/2 cup cheese and 1/2 cup chili. Repeat layers 2 more times. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with lettuce, tomatoes and salsa if desired.

Cut potatoes into 1 inch pieces. Cut carrots into 1 inch pieces. Cut hamburger into 1 inch pieces. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until translucent. Add carrots, potatoes and hamburger. Add soup mix and stir well to combine. Cook about 2 minutes to blend flavors. Pour into foil pouches. Seal the pouches tightly. Place pouches directly onto the grill or into the oven until the internal temperature of the meat reaches 160 degrees f. Serve with sour cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cut bacon in half and fry until crisp. Remove from heat and set aside. In a large skillet heat 1 tablespoon butter over medium high heat and cook onions for about 2 minutes or until tender, then set aside. In a bowl beat together the eggs and cream and add the onion and bacon and seasoning salt and pepper. Pour into a greased and buttered 9 inch pie pan or in an omelet pan that fits in the oven. Sprinkle with cheese and place in the preheated oven for 12 to 14 minutes or until set. Serve warm.

Melt margarine in large pan. Stir in sugar and vanilla. Add eggs one at a time, beating after each addition. In separate bowl, combine flour, cocoa powder and baking powder. Add to margarine mixture and beat until smooth. Fold in chocolate chips. Pour into 13x9-inch baking pan sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool completely on wire rack before cutting.

Bring water to boil& cook pasta according to package directions. While pasta is cooking& saute garlic in oil for 1 minute. Add green beans& potatoes& saute for 8 minutes or until tender. Add tomatoes& broth& cook for 1 minute or until heated through& blend& stirring occasionally. Drain pasta& combine with vegetable mixture& toss well. Top with pesto sauce& serve immediately.

In medium bowl, combine macaroni and milk. In large bowl mix the egg, flour, salt and cheese. Add macaroni mixture and stir until just mixed. Turn into unbaked 9 inch pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until set. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
Brown ground beef with chopped onion. Drain fat. Add carrots, potatoes, corn, tomato paste, water, bouillon cube, garlic. Cook until vegetables are tender. Serve with bread.

In a large pot, add beans and cover with 5 cups of water and soak for 8 hours or overnight. Drain beans and rinse well under running water and add in new water (5 cups) and boil for 1 hour or until tender. In a skillet heat oil on high heat and add in onion and garlic and sauté for 5 minutes. Season with chili powder and ground cumin and cook for 1 minute more. Then add in beans and boiling water and cook for 10 minutes. In another pot of boiling water add in rice and cook for 20 minutes or until tender. Combine cooked rice with beans and serve warm.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook until al dente. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Add bacon and cook until crisp. Add garlic and cook for about 30 seconds. Add the spaghetti and mix. Stir in the peas and ricotta cheese. Remove from heat and stir in the cream and Parmesan. Add the parsley. Transfer the spaghetti to a serving platter and sprinkle with additional parsley and Parmesan. Serve with additional Parmesan if desired.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Stir in broth and bring mixture to a boil over high heat. Add chicken, return mixture to boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-high, cover and simmer until chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes. Transfer chicken to platter. Increase heat under broth mixture to highboil until reduced by half, about 2 minutes. Add mustardboil for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Stir in honey and cook until thickened slightly, about 1 minute. Spoon mixture over chicken. Garnish with parsley. Serve with parsnips if desired.

Beat sugar and butter until light and fluffy. Beat in milk and vanilla. Stir in cocoa and oats. Drop by teaspoonful on greased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees f for 8-10 minutes. Allow cookies to cool on cookie sheet for 2-3 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

Serve over toast add more garlic powder or garlic salt if like. Enjoy and be at ease.

Combine rum and apricot brandy in a shaker with ice cubes. Shake vigorously. Strain into a tall glass filled with ice cubes. Top with orange juice and pineapple juice. Drizzle with grenadine. Garnish with an orange slice.

Slice the carrot into half moons. Melt the butter in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the sugar. Stir in the carrot. Cover and cook until carrots are tender. Add the cider, vegetable stock, dijon mustard and parsley. Cook for another 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large skillet heat oil over medium high heat. Add onion and mushrooms. Cook until mushrooms are soft, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. In a small bowl mix together roasted red bell pepper, red pepper flakes, and garlic. Stir well. Spread pasta into a 13 x 9 baking dish. Add roasted red bell pepper mixture to pasta. Pour mushroom mixture over pasta. Sprinkle cheese over pasta. Bake for 20 minutes or until hot and bubbly.

Saute sausage until browned. Drain. Saute ground beef in same frying pan until browned. Drain. In a 9x13 casserole, layer sausage, then meat, then cheese, then sausage, etc., ending with cheese on top. Pour over fried sausage grease, worcestershire sauce, oregano and garlic powder. Cover with foil. Bake 1 hour at 350 degrees. Uncover, bake another 15 minutes. Serve with rye rounds for dipping.

Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and saut for 1 to 2 minutes or until fragrant. Add eggplant, season with salt and pepper to taste. Sauté for 5 minutes or until eggplant is tender. Add tomatoes and continue to saut until tomatoes are softened. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Meanwhile, spread 1 side of each bread slice with roasted red pepper spread. Spread 1 side of each bread slice with eggplant mixture. Top each sandwich with a slice of cheese. Broil for 2 minutes or until cheese is melted and bread is lightly toasted. Makes 12 small sandwiches.
Mix together chicken, mustard, cream cheese and lemon juice. Shape into 1-inch balls and roll into mixed nuts. Serve with crackers.

Combine the refried beans and the ground beef in a large bowl and add the taco seasoning mix and water and mix well. Set aside while you prepare the tortillas and taco sauce. Heat the tortillas in the microwave for 30 seconds at a time until they are soft and pliable. Heat the taco sauce and add the onion and heat through until warm. Heat a large nonstick fry pan over medium heat and add a small amount of the meat mixture, about a tablespoon at a time and flatten with a spatula. When the bottom is browned, flip and brown on the other side. Add the meat mixture in a line along the center of each tortilla, and roll up like a burrito and place in a microwaveable casserole dish. Top with taco sauce and sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese. Heat through for about a minute and a half in the microwave and serve with sour cream and salsa on the side.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl, toss the carrots with the mayonnaise. Add the prepared horseradish, onion and pepper. Spoon into an 8-in. square baking dish coated with cooking spray. Combine the breadcrumbs and buttersprinkle over the carrot mixture. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Top with the cheesebake 10 more minutes or until the cheese is bubbly. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Makes 6 servings.
Preheat oven to 175 degrees celsius. Cream butter and cheese until smooth. Stir in flour and seasonings. Press onto a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes. Cool and store in an airtight container.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the angel hair pasta for 4 minutes. Drain. Meanwhile, in a large saute pan over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the garlic cloves and cook until lightly browned. Add the fresh basil leaves and the pasta and toss well. Season with salt and pepper. Place in a serving bowl and top with the avocado and tomatoes. Serve immediately.

Sprinkle the fillets with lemon juice, and place in a shallow dish. Mix the mustard with the butter, and spread this over the fillets. Season with pepper and sprinkle with parsley. Top with breadcrumbs to cover. Bake in a preheated oven at 180 degrees celcius for about 15 minutes, until the topping is golden brown and crisp. Serve with a slice of lemon.

Place all but carrots in saucepan and bring to boil. Cook and stir until thick and clear. Dissolve cornstarch and hot water in small amount of cold water and add to carrot mixturecook and stir until thickened and clear. Stir in lemon zest and carrots. Cook until heated through and carrots are tender. Serve warm or cold.

Cook potatoes in water to cover for 20 minutes or until tenderadd bay leaves and seasonings. Drain peasadd to potatoestoss. Melt butter in small saucepan over medium heatcook 5 minutes or until bubbly. Pour over potatoestoss.

Place sausage in a skillet and cook until browned. Break up with a fork. Add flour and stir to mix well. Add sour cream and mix well. Add milk and bring to a boil. Stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in pepper. Serve hot. Serves 4.

Cream the butter and sugar together. Add the vanilla and egg. Mix until combined and set aside. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, salt and baking powder. Add the dry mix into the wet mix and mix until combined. Roll the dough into small balls (about a teaspoonful) and place onto parchment paper or wax paper on a cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for about 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Let cool completely on the cookie sheets for about an hour. Melt the chocolate confectionary coating in the microwave or in a double boiler. Dip one end of each cookie into the melted chocolate and place on parchment paper or wax paper on another cookie sheet. Let the cookies set for about an hour before serving. You can also roll them in chopped nuts if you like.

In a large saucepan combine tea bags with boiling water. Cover and let steep 5 minutes. Remove tea bags. Add whole cloves, cinnamon sticks, sugar, splenda, and water. Heat to boiling. Serve hot. Makes 5 quarts.

Slice potatoes thinly and soak in water for 15 minutes. Remove from water, pat dry with paper towel. Melt butter in frying pan over medium heat. Add potatoes and turn until both sides are slightly browned. Salt to taste. Add cajun seasoning and toss well until potatoes are covered. Place on baking sheet and bake for about an hour. Turn potatoes once half way through baking time. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Grease large baking sheet or jelly-roll pan with cooking spray. Tie asparagus spears together into bundles about 1 inch apart. Place on baking sheetspray again with cooking spray. Sprinkle each bundle with bacon bits. Combine Worcestershire sauce, brown sugar, butter, and garlicbrush over spears. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes or until tender. Cool for 5 minutesserve immediately. Serves 4 to 6.

In saucepan, combine sugar, corn syrup and milk. Cook over low heat until mixture comes to a boil. Stir in chocolate. Cook to boilingremove from heat. Cool for about an hour. Beat with electric mixer until frosting is spreadable. Frosting will keep for about two weeks.

Bring the water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add the raisins. After 30 seconds remove the pan from heat. Drain the raisins. Heat the olive oil in a medium skillet. Add the garlic and saute for 30 seconds or until it is fragrant. Add the spinach. Season with salt and pepper. Add the pine nuts. Stir until the pine nuts are toasted. Drain the raisins and add them to the skillet. Stir to combine. Serve the spinach hot.
In a blender mix ice cream, syrup, and coffee. Blend until smooth. Add milk as needed to get desired consistency. Serve in a large glass with a straw.

Preheat oven to 375. Peel and slice potatoes into 1/4-inch slices. In a large baking dish, layer potatoes and ham and sprinkle with soup. Top with cheddar cheese. Bake 1 hour. Uncover and bake until potatoes are tender. Serve hot.

Combine dry ingredients and set aside. In a large bowl whisk together buttermilk, egg and butter. Add wet and dry ingredients and mix well. Fold in bacon and jalapeno. Spray 24 muffin cups with cooking spray or use paper liners. Spoon batter into cups about 3/4 full. Bake 15-20 minutes until browned and a toothpick comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes in pan then remove and cool completely on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cut eggplant lengthwise into 1/2-inch thick slices. Cut slices into 4-inch long fingers. Lightly brush each finger with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt, celery salt, and pepper. Place on baking tray. Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Beat eggs in a bowl. In another bowl, combine bread crumbs with parmesan cheese. Dip each finger in egg mixture, then in bread crumb mixture, turning to coat. Place on a baking tray. Bake at 400f for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve immediately.
Mix tomato mixture into the pasta. Toss in the feta and parmesan. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. In a small bowl whisk together the marmalade, soy sauce and garlic. Place the fish in a shallow baking dish. Spread the marmalade mixture over the fish and sprinkle with salt. Bake for 15 minutes or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.

1.Clean the sweetbreads, washing them well under cold water and then soaking them in cold water for an hour or two. Drain and rinse the sweetbreads and set aside. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large skillet over medium heat, brown the bacon and remove it from the pan and set aside. Add the butter and the flour to the bacon drippings and stir until the flour has cooked for about 30 seconds. Add the garlic powder and stir until the mixture is well blended and the garlic powder is incorporated into the flour. Add the sweetbreads and stir until all of the sweetbreads are coated in the mixture. Add the vinegar, salt and water and stir well until the sweetbreads are thoroughly coated in the liquid. Transfer the mixture into a roasting pan and put it into the oven for about half an hour, or until the sweetbreads are cooked through. Garnish with the bacon and serve with hot buttered toast or mashed potatoes and gravy.name

Place pork in shallow bowlsprinkle with apple juice and maple syrup. Season with cinnamon and nutmeg. Arrange apples, pork chops and squash in baking dishsprinkle with remaining apple juice, maple syrup, cinnamon and nutmeg. Bake until apples are tender and pork is no longer pink when center is pierced with a meat thermometer, about 1 hour 15 minutes. Meanwhile, cook rice in chicken stock according to package directions. Serve rice with pork chops and squash.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Heat a skillet over medium heatadd butter. Add country ham to skillet, breaking it up into small pieces with a spatula.Add red bell pepper to pan, stirring until peppers are cooked down to desired consistency. Add eggs to panscramble until eggs are cooked through, stirring constantly with a spatula.Pour eggs into a glass baking dishtop with sour cream.Bake in preheated oven until eggs are set, 7 to 9 minutes.Remove from ovensprinkle with cheddar cheese.Let stand until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

Preheat the oven to 180C/gas 4. Grease and line a 900g square tin. In a large bowl mix the oats, sugar, golden syrup and honey together. Melt the butter in a pan. Add the egg and beat until well mixed and combined. Add the egg to the dry ingredients and mix well until the mixture is smooth and no lumps remain. Pour into the prepared tin and bake for 35 - 45 minutes. Serve hot with a drizzle of golden syrup and a dollop of butter or honey.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix cookie mix, egg and oil together. Press into a 13x9x2 inch pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool. Meanwhile, microwave jam for about 40 seconds until it is a little liquid and add white chocolate. Spread over cooled cookie base. Whisk together milk and cream cheese frosting. Spread over the jam. Refrigerate until set. Cut into squares and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Mix flour, sugars, baking powder, salt and baking soda. Cut in shortening. Stir in eggs until well mixed. Stir in orange peel. Pour into baking pan. Bake 40-50 minutes. Cool 10 minutes in pan. Combine glaze ingredients. Drizzle over warm bread. Sprinkle with cranberries. Cool completely. Makes 1 loaf.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 13-by-9-inch baking pan. In large bowl, combine cake mix, chocolate chips and pecan pieces. Stir in kahlua, half-and-half and egg substitute. Spoon into prepared pan. Bake 30 minutes. In small bowl, combine 1/2 cup sweetened flaked coconut and 2 teaspoons kahluaset aside. In medium bowl, combine remaining sweetened flaked coconut, sugar, butter and 1/4 teaspoon kahluastir until crumbly. Spread over warm cake. Cool. Drizzle with remaining kahlua. Sprinkle with reserved coconut mixture. Store loosely covered. Makes 16 servings.

Place almonds in a small skillet over low heat. Cook, stirring frequently until lightly toasted 1 to 2 minutes. In a small bowl combine asparagus, oil, garlic and pepper. Place asparagus spears in a single layer on a baking sheet. Sprinkle evenly with toasted almonds. Bake about 10 minutes or until asparagus is crisp-tender. Cool slightly before serving.

Combine milk and eggs. Mix well and cook in saucepan over medium heat until mixture is thick. Add sugar and vanilla. Add rice. Cook over low heat for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Add flour and margarine. Mix well. Turn into greased 13 by 9 inch baking pan. Bake in 350 degree oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until set.

Combine breadcrumbs and flour. Mix in margarine and seasonings. Set aside. Heat 1 cup oil in heavy saucepan until very hot. Dip chicken in flour and then in egg. Next dip chicken into coating. Fry in hot oil for 3 minutes. Turn and fry 3 minutes more. Drain on paper towels. Makes 8 servings.

Cut the tenderloin into 4 pieces. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the pork pieces and cook until brown on all sides. Remove from heat. Add onion, wine, honey and rosemary to pan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer until pork is tender, about 20 minutes. Serve over rice.

In a saucepan boil 4 cups of the water with 1 1/2 teaspoons of salt. Add the rice. Cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 35 minutes. In a 4-quart saucepan, heat the remaining 3 cups of water over high heat. Add the chicken and cook for 3 minutes or until browned. Add the vegetables and cook for 5 minutes. Combine the chicken mixture with the rice mixture and stir in the butter. Cook for an additional 10 minutes.
In large bowl, toss together greens, apples, pecans, cherries and blue cheese. In small bowl, combine mustard, vinegar, syrup, oil, salt and pepper. Pour over greens mixturetoss well.

Cream butter and add lemon juice. Add basil, marjoram and rosemary, chopping with a knife or whipping in a food processor. Add lemon zest and chopped garlic. Chill for 2 hours or overnight. Use as you would any herb butter.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook until al dente, 9-10 minutes. Drain the pasta in a colander, rinse with cold water and drain again. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the heavy cream and garlic salt. Heat for 3 minutes until hot but not boiling. Remove from the heat, stir in the pasta and Parmesan cheese. Toss to combine until the pasta is coated with the sauce. Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer to a 9x13 baking dish. Cover with foil. Bake until heated through and bubbly, 10-15 minutes. Top with Pecorino romano cheese before serving. Serve with extra Parmesan cheese on the side for garnish if desired.

In the crock pot combine meat, onion soup mix, tomato sauce, and water. Add potatoes and carrots on top of meat. Cover. Bake on high for 4 hours or on low for 8 hours or until tender. Serve with buns or biscuits.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line 15x10x1-inch baking pan with foil. Grease foil with cooking spray. Place chicken halves in prepared baking dish. Beat egg white and water together in shallow bowl. Place bread crumbs in shallow bowl. Dip both sides of each chicken half into egg white mixture. Press into bread crumbs to coat. Bake in preheated oven 30 minutes. Turn and bake 10 minutes more or until done. Remove from oven and cool. Cut each half into 6 slices. Arrange 2 slices on each piece of bread. Top with goat cheese, sprinkle with white pepper and drizzle with spaghetti sauce. Top with mozzarella cheese. Roll up and place seam side down. Bake in preheated oven 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Cook tuna in a covered saucepan with 1 can of the beans for 15 minutes. Add tomatoes, celery, green onions, parsley and 2 tablespoons of dressing and cook until tender-about 15 minutes longer. Combine with remaining beans and toss well to blend. Prepare egg as directed on package and slice into quarters. Arrange lettuce leaf on plate and spoon salad on top. Garnish with egg and olives. Serves 4 to 6.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and celerysaute until onion is translucent and celery is tender, about 4 minutes. Add bell pepper and continue to saute until pepper is tender. Add turkey and continue to saute until turkey is browned. Transfer mixture to a 2 quart casserole dish. In a medium bowl combine tomato paste and beef broth. Pour over the turkey mixture. Add water and barley. Cover and simmer for about 25 minutes or until barley is tender. Salt and pepper to taste.
Place all the ingredients except the paprika in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Transfer to a medium bowl and stir in the paprika. Serve with warm pita bread.

In a bowl combine garlic, olive oil, vinegar and oregano and basil and mix well. Marinate chicken thighs in mixture for several hours. Thread chicken thighs onto skewers. Grill over medium heat for about five minutes on each side or until cooked through. Makes four servings.
Cut watermelon and strawberries into small pieces. Place in blender. Add frozen lemonade and sugar. Blend. Pour over ice. Squeeze lemon over drink and place lemon slice in drink.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Combine rice cereal, flour, salt, thyme and poultry seasoning. Place in a zip-lock bag and shake to combine well. Dip each piece of chicken into the butter, then coat with the seasoning mixture. Place chicken into a baking dish. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through (170 degrees F).

Heat oil in large skillet. Saute onion and pepper until tender. Add eggs and cook. Sprinkle with picante sauce. Stir in sour cream and cheese. Bake at 350f. until heated through. Serve with tortillas.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease a 8 inch round pan with softened butter or margarine. Mix together butter, white sugar, and almond extract until well blended. Add flour, baking powder, ground almonds. Mix until well blended. Spread batter into the pan. Place cherries evenly spaced on top of the batter. Bake in a preheated oven about 30-35 minutes or until the cake is golden brown and springs back when touched on top. Cool on a rack before serving.

Cook frozen tater tots as directed on the package. Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Meanwhile, brown ground turkey in large nonstick skillet. Drain fat. Add cut green beans and cook until heated through. In a bowl combine soup and milk and mix. Add to turkey mixture. Add tater tots and cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F for 25 minutes.

Heat a grill or grill pan over medium heat. Season the beef mixture with the chile powder and the chipotle chile. Form the mixture into patties about 3/4 inch thick. Cook the patties in the pan until browned and no longer pink in the center, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Spread the barbecue sauce on one side of the rolls. Top the bottom halves of the rolls with the beef patties, the cheese, the lettuce, the tomatoes and the teriyaki sauce. Top with the remaining roll halves. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease baking sheets. Cream butter and sugar. Add eggmix well. Stir in almond extract. In another bowl combine flour, baking soda, salt. Stir into creamed mixture. Divide dough into 4 portionsform each portion into an oblong log. Wrap each log tightly with aluminum foil. Place on baking sheets. Chill for at least 2 hours. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Bake logs for 25 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes. Roll logs in almonds. Place on waxed paper to cool completely. Makes about 7 dozen.

Cut bread into 1-inch cubes and place in bottom of a 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Spread cubes with tomatoes. Sprinkle with green onions and mozzarella cheese. In large bowl whisk together the eggs, milk and basil. Season with salt and pepper. Pour over bread. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove from refrigerator 1 hour before baking. Preheat oven to 350 f. Bake for 30-40 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving. Makes 6-8 servings.

Prepare rice mix according to package directions. Set aside. Slice artichokes in half. Cut in slices. Cut tomatoes in halves or slices. Cut bell pepper in slices. Slice parsley. Chop capers. Squeeze lemons and rind to get all the juice. Combine all ingredients in a large salad bowl. Toss gently. Chill. Enjoy.
Combine first four ingredients. Rub over chicken. Roast for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

Combine water and egg white in a small saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens slightly. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and salt. Place pecans in a single layer on an ungreased baking sheet. Pour mixture over pecans. Using a rubber spatula, spread mixture evenly to cover pecans. Bake at 200 degrees F for 1 hour. Remove from oven and spread pecans out on a baking sheet to cool. Once cooled, sprinkle with cinnamon. Store tightly covered in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

In a medium bowl stir together crushed pineapple, orange juice, sugar and orange zest. Let stand for 1 hour. In a large bowl whisk together egg yolks and vanilla. Beat in gelatin. Then pour into pineapple mixture. In a separate bowl beat together cheese and egg whites. Then fold into pineapple mixture. Pour into pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour. Cool then chill.

Mix cream cheese, imitation crabmeat and seasonings in a bowl. Fill wonton skins with a teaspoon of mixture. In a deep skillet, heat butter and oil. Add wontons and brown on both sides. Add water. Bring to a boil and cover. Cook 15 minutes or until done. Drain and serve with sweet and sour sauce.

Mix graham cracker crumbs, sugar and butter in bowl. Press into bottom of 9-inch spring form pan. Combine cream cheese and fat free cream cheese until smooth. Add lime juice and vanilla. Mix until smooth. Add eggs and mix well. Pour cheesecake filling over crust. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Cool. Chill for 4 hours. Top with whipped topping. Serve.

In a medium saucepan, bring 3 cups water to a boil. Add 1 cup wild rice. Coverreduce heat. Cook 45 minutes or until tender. In a large pot of boiling water, cook corn for 5 minutes. Drain. Combine wild rice, corn, milk, eggs and 1/2 teaspoon saltadd 1 tablespoon butter. Combine 1/4 cup butter and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a 13x9-inch baking dish. Pour mixture over buttersprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from ovenlet stand 10 minutes. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon butterserve.

Slice off the top of the green bell peppers. Cut out the seeds and white pith. In a large skillet over medium heat, add the olive oil, garlic cloves, sea salt and fresh ground black pepper. Cook for 3 minutes until the garlic is golden. Add the sliced green bell peppers to the skillet. Cook for 10 minutes or until the bell peppers are tender. Serve hot.

Cook cabbage in a saucepan of boiling water 10 minutes or until tender crisp. Drain cabbageplace in a bowl. Add bell pepper and next 6 ingredients. Toss gently. Drizzle with mayonnaise. Serve immediately. Garnish with nuts.

In a medium bowl combine the sugar, dry mustard, salt and cider vinegar. Gradually beat in the onion juice. Slowly add the canola oil while beating. Refrigerate until serving time. When ready to serve, stir the poppy seeds into the dressing. Toss the fruit with the dressing. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

Preheat oven to 375. In a large bowl, combine sugar, cornstarch and pie spice. Add peaches. Turn into a 9 inch pie plate. Dot with butter and dot with a second pie crust. Seal and crimp edges. Cut slits into top of pie crust. Bake for 35 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 and bake for an additional 35 minutes. Makes 8 servings.

Cook the chicken in boiling water till cooked through. Remove from heat and cool. Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. In a medium bowl, mix together cream of chicken soup, cream cheese, cumin and garlic. Stir in green chilies and cooked chicken. Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour. Serve with colby-monterey jack cheese and tortilla chips.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil or parchment paper.Spray the wonton wrappers lightly with cooking spray. Fill each wrapper with about 1 teaspoon of ricotta cheese and 1 teaspoon of baby spinach. Press the edges together to seal. Place the pillows on the prepared baking sheet.Bake until the pillows are browned on the edges, about 20 to 25 minutes. Sprinkle the tops of the pillows evenly with grated Parmesan cheese while they are still hot from the oven.Allow to cool for 2 to 3 minutes before serving.Makes 12 pillows.

Remove the pin bones from the salmon fillets by running a knife along the side of the fillet until you reach the pin bone which you can then remove with tweezers. Sprinkle the salmon fillets with the garlic and rub in the paprika and salt and pepper. Place the fillets skin side down on a foil lined baking sheet and sprinkle the top of the fillets with the lemon juice and top with the capers. Bake the salmon for 20 minutes at 425 degrees and turn and continue cooking until done. Remove from the oven and drizzle the french dressing over the top of the salmon and sprinkle with the parsley or any other garnish of your choice. Serve with a green salad and rolls and you have a nice easy meal.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Drain potato and slice thinly into rounds. Toss in olive oil to coat then season with salt. Roast in oven until golden brown and tender. While potatoes are roasting combine all other ingredients in a bowl. Slice chicken breast into thin strips. Add chicken to the bowl with the potatoes, tomatoes, lemon juice, lemon zest and olives. Toss gently to combine then add the garlic cloves. Toss again to combine then remove the garlic cloves. Spoon mixture evenly into each chicken breast then wrap the chicken with the potato mixture. Bake in oven until chicken is cooked through.

In a large skillet, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon to paper towels to drainset aside. In same skillet, cook onion and garlic until onion is softened and translucent. Add black beans and bacon. Season with salt and pepper. Add cumin and hot sauce to taste and stir well to combine. Top with sour cream and serve with warm corn tortillas.

In a large skillet cook the ground beef over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain off fat. Add the beans and 1/2 cup water. Cook and stir until heated through. Place the polenta in a medium saucepan. Stir in the chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Cook over medium heat until the polenta is tender. Stir in the beef mixture and salsa. Spoon the polenta mixture into 12 individual casserole dishes. Top with cheese. Bake at 400 for 10-12 minutes or until the cheese is melted.

Cook potatoes in a medium pot of boiling water until fork tender. Drain and return potatoes to pot. Add butter, half-and-half and garlic. Mash with a potato masher. Add goat cheese, basil and salt to taste. Serve hot.

Mix together the teriyaki sauce and olive oil. Coat the steaks. Broil or grill to desired doneness. While steaks are cooking, fry oysters. To serve, place steak in the center of the plate. Top with the oysters. Drizzle the oyster dressing over the steaks.

Mix maple syrup and brown sugar in a small saucepan and heat until the mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat and cook until the mixture thickens slightly. Add the butter and stir until it melts. Add water and bring to a boil again. Add half-and-half and vanilla. Boil for one more minute and remove from heat. Stir in nuts and cool slightly before serving.

Whisk together lemonade concentrate, honey and poppy seeds until blended. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Arrange fruit on a serving platter and pour dressing over the top just before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350F (180C). Combine butter and sugars and cream well. Add eggs one at a time and beat well after each addition. Add vanilla and milk and stir to combine. In another bowl, combine flours, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt. Add to creamed mixture alternately with chocolate chips and beat well after each addition. Cover and chill dough for 2 hours or until firm enough to shape. Roll dough into 1-inch balls (about 1 tablespoon) and place 1-inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes or until edges are firm but centers are still soft. Cool on wire racks. Note : can also use white chocolate chips instead of milk chocolate chips if desired.

Cut baking potatoes in half lengthwise and place in baking dish. Cover with water. Add a few drops of oil and sprinkle with cajun seasoning. Bake for about 1 hour. Serve with salt and pepper.

Combine artichoke hearts, parmesan cheese and thyme in a food processor. Pulse until mixture is coarse but still crumbly. Season with salt and pepper. Preheat broiler to high. Lightly brush the chicken with oil and sprinkle the seasoning mixture on top of the chicken breasts. Broil until the chicken breasts are done and the mixture is browned and bubbly around the edges, about 6 minutes per side. Serve with lemon wedges for squeezing.

In a small bowl, combine the mushrooms and lemon juice. Set aside. In a medium bowl, combine the dressing and asparagus spears. Spoon the salad onto plates and garnish with the almonds and mushrooms. Serve immediately.

Mix together the butter and honey. Add the oats and stir until coated with the honey mixture. Pour the mixture onto a large baking tray and bake for around 1 hour until golden and crisp. Leave to cool and add the remaining ingredients.

Place the edamame in a bowl of hot water to thaw. Cook edamame in the microwave for 2 to 3 minutes or until the beans are hot. Combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Spoon the edamame onto serving plates. Drizzle with the dressing. Serve immediately.

Soften the cream cheese in a microwave safe bowl for 45 seconds to a minute. Add the sausage and mash up with a fork until smooth. Add all other ingredients except for parsley and chives and mix well. Garnish with parsley and chives. Serve with crackers or bread.

Preheat oven to 350. Coat a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Place fillets in dish. Sprinkle with thyme. Bake tilapia fillets for 12-15 minutes or until fish is flaky. Heat chicken broth in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add mushroom and cook 2-3 minutes. Remove mushroom from broth. Reduce heat to low. Add dijon mustard to broth. Stir in whipping cream. Cook until slightly thickened. Spoon sauce over tilapia. Serve.

In a medium bowl combine 1 cup butter, 1 can barbecue sauce and 1 1/2 cups sugar. Mix until smooth. Add 2 eggs, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1 teaspoon ground ginger. Mix until smooth. In a large bowl combine 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda and 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves. Stir into butter mixture. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Cool on wire rack. In a small bowl combine 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar and enough barbecue sauce to make a glaze. Drizzle over warm cookies. Cool completely. Makes about 6 dozen.

Mix together cornstarch and 1/4 cup milk in a sauce pan. Cook until thickened. Add cheeses, champagne, almond extract & ground nutmeg. Cook for about 5 minutes. Serve with apple slices & cubed french bread. Dip bread in warm cheese mixture. Dip apples in cheese mixture. Serve with fresh ground pepper.

Heat olive oil in nonstick skillet over medium low heat. Add tuna and onions, and cook until tuna is cooked through (about 5 minutes). Add beans, pecorino cheese, oregano, and spinach leaves. Cook until spinach is wilted (about 5 minutes). Pour beaten eggs over mixture, then continue cooking until eggs are set on the bottom of the skillet (about 5 minutes). Cook on the top of the stove until the rest of the eggs are set (about 10 minutes). Flip over onto a plate and serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 250°F. Slice the eggplants in half lengthwise. Brush them with oil, season with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Place on a baking sheet & bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until the eggplants are soft. Meanwhile, cut the plum tomatoes in half lengthwise & brush them with the extra virgin olive oil. Sprinkle with coarse sea salt. In a small bowl mix together the chopped basil leaves with the extra virgin olive oil & a pinch of coarse sea salt. Arrange the eggplant halves on the bread. Top each with a tomato half & a slice of buffalo mozzarella. Drizzle with the basil oil & serve.

Beat cream cheese and sugar until fluffy. Add eggs 1 at a time. Add frozen orange juice concentrate. Pour into pie crust. Top with mandarin oranges in juice. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 50 minutes. Let pie cool. Spread with light brown sugar.

Boil carrots in water until tender. Add pears, crushed pineapple, and spices. Boil until pears are tender. Remove from heat and add sugar. Add pectin. Return to heat and bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Ladle into hot jars, leaving 1/4 inch headspace. Wipe rims and seal. Makes 4 1/2 pints.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add chicken and cook until lightly browned stirring frequently. Add kidney beans, tomato sauce, salsa, chili powder, cayenne pepper, garlic clove, salt, and black pepper. Reduce to low, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in half of the cheese. Spoon into 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle remaining cheese over the top and bake for 15-20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Using an electric mixer on medium speed, beat butter until smooth. Add sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs 1 at a time. Mix well after each addition. On low speed, beat in flour and cornstarch. Beat until well mixed. Divide batter into 4 portions. On a lightly floured surface, roll each portion into a 9-inch circle. Cut circles into 8 wedges. Using a fork, pierce each wedge to the center. Place 1 teaspoon jam in the center of each wedge. Fold wedges to form triangles. Place on prepared baking sheets. Bake 12-15 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pans to cool completely. Dust with confectioners' sugar if desired. Makes about 64 cookies.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).Wash the red potatoes, and leave whole or slice in half lengthwise, depending on the size of the potato. Arrange the potatoes on a baking sheetdrizzle with the olive oil and sprinkle with the salt and pepper.Roast in the preheated oven until the potatoes are fork tender and browned around the edges, about 25 minutes.Remove from the oven and place potatoes in a bowl with the minced garlic and fresh rosemarytoss to coat thoroughly.Taste, and add more salt or pepper if necessary.Allow to cool slightly before serving.

Heat a large skillet over high heat with a touch of vegetable oil until it is smoking hot. Add brussels sprouts and toss until they are nicely browned on all sides. This should take about 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and add the sriracha sauce and honey. Toss together and sprinkle with some chopped fresh cilantro and a squeeze of lime juice. Serve immediately.

Beat together the eggs and icing sugar until light and creamy, add kirsch and mix well. Add aniseed and salt and mix well, sieve in the flour a little at a time until well mixed. Turn out onto a floured surface and knead lightly until smooth. Roll out thinly on a floured board and cut out with a small cutter or use a pastry bag with a small round nozzle to make the biscuits. Place on a baking sheet and bake in a moderate oven for 10-15 minutes. Cool on a rack.

In a medium saucepan, combine the water and the sugar. Bring to a boil over high heat. When the mixture reaches 240 degrees F (116 degrees C), remove it from the heat. Add the cream of tartar and stir until the sugar dissolves completely. Pour the syrup into a clean glass jar or bottle. Store the syrup in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Grease 9x5x3 inch loaf pan. Combine flour, sugar, baking soda and saltset aside. In large bowl, combine bananas, vegetable oil, eggs, and vanillabeat well. Add flour mixturebeat well. Stir in chocolate chips. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 50-60 minutes. Cool on rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pancool completely.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a 2 1/2-quart slow cooker, combine soup mixes, water, beef and carrots. Covercook on low for 8-10 hours or on high for 4-5 hours. Remove roastshred meat. Return to cooker. Stir in sour cream. Heat through. Serve on hot rolls.
Heat butter and oil over medium heat. Dust veal with flour and saute until golden brown. Add tomatoes, garlic, parsley and wine. Simmer until tender. Sprinkle with oregano and serve over pasta.

Melt margarine in large skillet. Add onions and saute until tender. Stir in flour and saute 1 minute. Add soymilk and water gradually. Cook over low heat until thickened. Stir in garlic powder and season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in beans. Pour into casserole. Sprinkle with french-fried onions. Bake at 350 f for 25 minutes.

Toss broccoli with olive oil flavored cooking spray. Add the teriyaki sauce and stir well. Add the garlic and black pepper to taste. Roast in the oven at 375 until tender.

Mix all the ingredients in a bowl until smooth. Place in a 1-quart casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

In a large pot saute all of the vegetables in a little oil until just tender. Add chicken stock and tomatoes. Add chicken and spinach and simmer for 5 minutes until spinach wilts. In a large baking dish pour 1/2 of the chicken mixture into it and top with a layer of cheddar cheese. Repeat with another layer of chicken and then top with cheddar cheese. Bake at 375f until hot and bubbly 25 to 30 minutes. Serve with a tossed salad.

In a heavy bottom pot saute onion and butter until golden brown add in the potatoes and brussels sprouts, add in the bay leaf and sweet red pepper cook until tender stirring often add in the chicken stock and season with salt and pepper cook until tender serve garnished with parsley.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a bowl, toss beets, parsnips, carrots, brown sugar and 1 tablespoon oil. Spread in a single layer in a roasting pan. Roast 45 minutes to 1 hour or until vegetables are tender. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine vinegar, remaining oil, soy sauce and mustard. Transfer roasted vegetables to serving dish. Drizzle with dressing. Garnish with mushrooms.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place chicken thighs in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Stir together soy sauce, green onions, sesame oil, honey, garlic and ground gingerpour over chicken. Bake for 45 minutes, basting once or twice during baking. Serve with cooked rice and green beans.

In a small bowl combine water and gelatin mix. Place in microwave for 1 to 2 minutes. Mix in cheese and set aside. Cook sausage in a large skillet. Break open english muffins and spray with butter flavored cooking spray. Place a small amount of sausage in bottom half of english muffin. Break egg over sausage and place in microwave for 1 to 2 minutes. Take out of microwave and place cheese mixture over egg. Top with sausage and place top half of english muffin on top. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Heat large nonstick skillet sprayed with cooking spray over medium-high heat. Add steak and cook 2 minutes on each side or to desired doneness. Remove steak from pan. Add mushrooms, onion, soup, water, mustard and salt and pepper to taste. Cook 5 minutes. Spoon mixture over rice on plate. Top with steak. Garnish with parsley.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until tender. Drain and cool. Grate. In a small skillet, combine onion and flour and cook over moderately low heat, stirring constantly, until golden. Add vinegar and water and bring to boil. Cook for 1 minute. Cool and stir in radishes, cucumber and potato. Season to taste with salt and ground pepper. Serve at room temperature.

Place chicken in crock pot. In a medium bowl mix garlic powder, dried basil, salt, pepper, instant minced onion, garlic cloves, extra virgin olive oil, balsamic vinegar. Pour over chicken. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Remove chicken to a platter. Strain juices into a small saucepan. Heat juices to a boil. Lower heat. Add fresh parsley.

Sift together flour, salt, and baking powder. Set aside. In a large bowl, cream together sugar, butter, and vanilla until fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in flour mixture. Stir in dates and nuts. Pour batter into a greased and floured 10x15x1-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. Makes 15 servings.

Heat a griddle pan until hot. Layer bread with butter. Cook the bacon until just crisp. Layer bacon onto the bread. Slice the tomatoes and layer onto the sandwich. Sprinkle with the shredded cheese. Cook the sandwich until the bread is browned. Flip and brown the other side. Cut in half.

Combine the sugar and flour. Mix in the nutmeg and salt until evenly distributed throughout the mixture. In a separate bowl beat the eggs and add to the flour mixture. Add the butter and combine thoroughly. Add the rhubarb and mix until well blended. Divide the mixture between the pie crusts and bake at 400 degrees for 40-45 minutes.

Combine cream of chicken soup, whole kernel corn, cooked chicken and milk in large bowl. Add corn muffin mix and egg. Stir just until moistened. Spoon into 13x9 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 375f for 45 minutes or until golden brown and bubbly. Let stand for 10 minutes. Serve with additional milk if desired.

Heat olive oil in a pan over med heat. Cook the garlic for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add broccoli florets and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside to cool. In a serving bowl, combine chicken with broccoli, lemon juice, basil leaves, black pepper, and 2 cups of hot pasta. Top with tomatoes and parmesan cheese.

For the chicken: trim the bottoms off the lemongrass stalks. Cut the lemongrass stalks into 4-inch lengths. Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat until very hot. Add the lime rind, coriander leaves and lemongrass. Stir fry until the lemongrass becomes fragrant. Add the chicken breasts. Fry until golden brown. Remove chicken from pan. Add the lime juice, chiles and sugar. Bring to a boil. Stir until the sugar dissolves. Return chicken to pan. Stir fry until the chicken is coated with the sauce. For the sauce: in a small saucepan over medium heat, heat the oil until hot. Add the garlic. Stir until the garlic is golden brown. Add the sugar. Stir to dissolve. Add the lime juice. Stir. Pour over the chicken. Stir to blend. Remove from heat. Allow to cool. Garnish with cilantro.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package directionsdrain. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add sausagecook and stir until lightly browned. Remove from heat. Cook pasta according to package directionsdrain. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add sausagecook and stir until lightly browned. Add tomatoes and tomato sauce to sausage. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowsimmer for 10 minutes. Stir in pasta and 1/2 cup of the Parmesan cheese. Spread pasta mixture into a 13×9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with remaining Parmesan cheese. Bake for 25 minutes or until bubbly.
Combine tea bags, water, navel oranges, lemons, honey, lemon juice and 1/2 cup ginger ale. Cool and serve over ice with remaining ginger ale.

Put warm water, sugar, bread machine yeast and oil into the pan of your bread machine. Stir in skim milk powder. Pour into bread machine pan and sprinkle with white bread flour and salt. Start the bread machine and let it mix the dough for 30 seconds. Set the bread machine on the dough cycle. When cycle is finished, remove the dough to a lightly floured surface and knead by hand for 3 minutes. Place dough into a large lightly greased bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let rise until doubled about 1 hour. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 3 minutes. Divide dough into 2 pieces. Roll each piece into a ball. Place each ball into a lightly greased bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise until doubled about 1 hour. Heat oven to 400 degrees. Bake bread for 25 minutes. Let cool on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Trim off most of the fat from the pork, and cut the pork into large pieces so they will fit into a roasting pan. In a roasting pan or dutch oven, combine the pork with the water and soy sauce, and cook uncovered for about 3 hours. Remove the pork from the liquid and shred using two forks (or your hands). In the same pot that you cooked the pork in, combine the pork with the remaining ingredients, and cook uncovered for another 2 to 3 hours, stirring occasionally and adding water if needed to keep the meat moist and tender. Remove the pork from the liquid and place it on a serving platter. Combine the leftover liquid with the barbecue sauce and serve with the pulled pork. Serves 10-12.
Combine chocolate chips and margarine in microwave for about 3 minutes or until melted. Mix in nuts and marshmallows. Drop by teaspoon onto wax paper. Refrigerate. Unwrap and enjoy.

Season the beef stew meat with salt and pepper. Sauté the onion in a skillet with a little bit of olive oil until tender. In the crockpot combine the beef, the onion, beef bouillon cubes and water. Cook on high for about 3-4 hours. Stir in the cornstarch mixed with a little water to thicken. Add the red wine and serve over the cooked noodles.

Combine sugar and water in a large heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat. Stir until sugar dissolves. Cook until a candy thermometer reads 225 f. Remove from heat and add the butter and cream. Stir until combined. Pour into a buttered 9x13 pan. Let stand until firm. Roll into small balls. Roll in confectioners sugar. Lay out on wax paper to cool. Melt almond bark according to instructions. Dip the bottom of each ball into melted almond bark. Let harden and enjoy.

Mix garlic, salt, pepper and parmesan cheese to a paste. Slowly drizzle in oil, then vinegar. Mix well. Add egg yolk. Stir slowly until well combined. Add Worcestershire sauce to taste. Place in refrigerator until ready to serve. Just prior to serving, whisk vigorously until it thickens to desired consistency. Toss with lettuce. Sprinkle with bacon bits. Toss again. Serve immediately. Serves 6 to 8.

Rinse the chicken breast halves and pat dry. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the green onions and cook for 2 minutes. Add the jalapenos and cook 2 minutes. Add the lemon juice, honey and thyme. Cook until the mixture is thickened. Add the chicken breast halves and cook until no longer pink. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Cream together the butter and sugar. Add the eggs and milk and mix well. Mix the flour, baking powder and salt and add to liquid mixture. Add the cornmeal and mix well. Pour into greased muffin pan and bake for 10-12 minutes at 375 degrees.
name: quick and easy meatballsingredients: ground beef, bread crumbs, egg, ketchup, mustard, salt and pepperpreparation:Mix all ingredients together well, then form into small meatballs. Brown in a frying pan until cooked through, then cover and refrigerate until ready to use. These are great for meatball subs or in spaghetti sauce.

Place all liquid and vegetables in crockpot. Slice beef into 1-inch pieces. Place beef in liquid mixture. Cook on high for 4 hours. When done, remove beef and place in a bowl. Increase heat to high and cook until liquid thickens. Add sugar. Cook for 30 more minutes. Mix beef and liquid. Serve over rice. Serve with vegetables.

Heat oven to 350F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Beat butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add eggs and vanillamix well. Stir together flour, baking soda and saltadd to butter mixture and mix well. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto prepared baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown and set around edges. Let stand for 2 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven at 350f. Mix together eggs, banana, salt, sugar in a large bowl. Add potato flour in a little at a time until well mixed. Pour into a greased, non-stick 9 inch round cake pan. Bake for 45 minutes or until firm. Serve warm with whipped cream.

Spray the crock pot with cooking spray and add in the cheese spread. Melt the cream cheese and add it to the cheese spread. Add the rotel and let it simmer until the cream cheese is melted. Add the sausage and let it cook for about 30 minutes. Serve with crackers.

In a large skillet, heat oil then add garlic. Cook for 1 minute or until golden. Add the greens and bacon bits. Cook 2-3 minutes stirring constantly. Add white wine. Cook 1-2 minutes more. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve as a side dish.

Combine ice cream topping, milk, and pudding in a medium saucepan. Stir until smooth. Add 2 cups of the Cool Whip to the mixture. Spoon into pie crust. Top with remaining Cool Whip. Crush toffee bars and sprinkle on top. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serves 8.

Slice the chicken into 1/2" strips. Heat the vegetable oil on high and fry the chicken strips until cooked through. Drain the oil from the cooked strips and set aside. In a bowl, add the pineapple-orange juice concentrate and butter. Mix well. In a small bowl combine the ground ginger and soy sauce. In a separate bowl combine the flour and the soy sauce mixture. Combine all the above. Place the strips in the mixture to coat. Place the strips on a greased pan and cover with the pineapple-orange juice mixture. Cook on 350 for 25 minutes. Serve with rice.

In a bowl, combine barley and water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover and cook until barley is tender. Drain. In a bowl, toss barley with vinegar. Add olive oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use. Just before serving, toss barley again. Garnish with tomatoes and basil.

Place sweet onions in bottom of a crockpot and add beef brisket on top. In a small bowl combine garlic salt, spicy brown mustard and lemon pepper. Rub evenly over beef and place in crockpot. In a medium size bowl combine hickory and brown sugar barbecue sauce and bourbon. Pour over brisket in crockpot and cook on low heat for 6-8 hours or on high heat for 4-6 hours. Remove brisket from crockpot and keep warm in oven while you prepare sauce. Pour remaining sauce into a saucepan and heat on medium-high heat for 2-3 minutes or until it begins to thicken. Slice brisket and serve over sauce with any remaining sauce poured over top.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a large baking sheet. In a large bowl, combine all of the dry ingredients. In a separate bowl, mix together the wet ingredientspour them into the dry ingredients and mix well. Spread evenly on the baking sheet, bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Let granola cool completely before storing or eating.

In a large mixing bowl beat together margarine and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg and lemon juice concentrate. Blend well. Stir in flour, baking powder and lemon juice. Press into a 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Cool. Spread frosting over top. Mix together powdered sugar with lemon juice concentrate. Spread over top of cooled bar. Sprinkle with coconut. Store in refrigerator.
